summary: The Contaminated Wells Relocation Act authorizes the NASA Administrator to reimburse the Town of Chincoteague, Virginia, for costs associated with relocating contaminated drinking water wells. The bill focuses on the removal and replacement of existing wells on NASA-administered property and includes stipulations for a relocation plan, site descriptions, and cost estimates. The Administrator must submit any agreements reached with the town to relevant congressional committees within 18 months of the bill's enactment.
